references.paper_title: A cost function for similarity-based hierarchical clustering
references.reason: This paper introduces the Dasgupta cost, a fundamental metric for evaluating hierarchical clustering quality, which is extensively analyzed and used in the current research.

references.paper_title: Tree sampling divergence: an information-theoretic metric for hierarchical graph clustering
references.reason: This paper introduces the Tree-Sampling Divergence (TSD), another crucial metric for evaluating the quality of hierarchical clusterings, especially for graphs, which is also a core concept in the current work.

references.paper_title: End-to-end learning of probabilistic hierarchies on graphs
references.reason: This paper presents a flexible probabilistic hierarchy model (FPH) for learning hierarchies, which is directly compared against and improved upon by the current paper's proposed method.
This paper introduces the Ultrametric Fitting (UF) method, a continuous optimization approach for hierarchical clustering that serves as a key baseline for comparison in the current research.

references.paper_title: From trees to continuous embeddings and back: Hyperbolic hierarchical clustering
references.reason: This paper proposes Hyperbolic Hierarchical Clustering (HypHC), another continuous method for hierarchical clustering which is a strong competitor to the proposed approach in the current paper.
